text: guys want to know what my new favorite
dessert is it's this dessert chewy
chocolate brownies I spent a long time
getting those recipe right so I hope
it's your favorite too I just added 1/4
teaspoon of baking powder to 3/4 of a
cup plus 2 tablespoons of flour you
might think that that's like weird
amount and you'd be right normally I
don't like using strange amounts like
that I like to keep things simple but I
must have made just like 10 times before
I decided that it was good enough to
print so there are some interesting
moments in it and I'll share them all
with you this is 7 ounces of semi-sweet
chocolate and to that I'm adding 3
tablespoons of safflower oil you could
also use coconut oil if you want sort of
like a mound flavor profile which is
really delicious and to that add 7
tablespoons of unsalted butter I like
the flavor of butter better but you get
a certain amount of chewiness when you
use oil which is why I'm using a
combination and just like with the
amount of flour which is a little
unusual I went back and forth with the
amount of oil and the amount of butter
that I could use to get just the right
amount of chewiness without being
overwhelmingly oily flavored because
they don't really love that oil flavor I
settled on three tables maybe you don't
care about all the inner workings in my
mind but I'm sharing them with you
anyway you want to melt these together
in a double boiler the bottom of the pot
should be over but not touching
simmering water shouldn't take too long
for them to melt and as in all instances
really when you're cooking with
chocolate you want to choose the best
quality chocolate I like Valrhona or
guitard here both delicious chocolate
that's the major flavoring of your
brownie and you want it to be majorly
delicious right so keep an eye on it you
can also do this in the microwave if you
want to and then take it off now what
you want to do is add your sugar it's
got quite a bit of sugar but I used a
combination of light brown sugar one cup
and granulated sugar also one cup the
light brown sugar adds to the chewiness
and gives it sort of a deep ish caramel
flavor which I like
so then whisk your sugar into the
chocolate mixture you want it to
dissolve a little bit it's not going to
completely dissolve at this point so it
will look a little bit granular I guess
but with for about 10 seconds you can
see it's definitely still grainy looking
but the chocolate has been cooled down a
little bit by the sugar and now you can
add your eggs three large eggs and those
get whisked in as well at this point you
want to whisk for about 45 seconds it
seems a little overly exacting but what
I found was if you whisk it a lot like
that so that it gets kind of shiny the
egg whites rise to the top tearing
baking and make this beautiful crackly
crust and if you don't do that then that
doesn't happen if you like a cracker
crust on top of your brownies this is
one of the ways that you get it it's not
going to completely dissolve the sugar
so don't be looking for that but you're
looking for is an almost completely
dissolved sugar and sort of a shiny look
now you can stop whisking and stir in
your dry ingredients have your oven
preheating to 350 degrees program you
can pour this into a nine by nine pan
it's been buttered and lined with
parchment leaving an overhang the
overhang makes it easier to remove the
brownies when they're done you just want
to eat that now I do because of the
amount of chocolate in here it sets up
really quickly starts getting a little
bit stiff so spread it out quickly and
then get it into your oven you can make
this in an 8x8 if you want to it'll be a
little bit thicker and slightly less
chewy you bake it in an 8x8 you'll bake
it a little bit longer and it'll be a
little bit fuzzier just get this into
your 350 degree oven want to bake it
until and cake tester inserted in the
center comes out with moist crumbs
attached that'll be like 35 to 40
minutes you're going to want to let
these cool which I have done which is
good because then I get to try them and
that's what it's all about right getting
to eat them I cook because I like to eat
that's a little secret that I thought I
would share with you in case you didn't
know that already
the center's a little bit fuzzier the
edges are a little bit chewier so you're
going to get a little bit of something
everybody mmm the two edges are what I
like a lot of people really like the
fudge the interior so you try them you
make them you eat them you tell me if
you like the 2 edges or the fuzzy
interior better comments below
[Music]
